intro: Matelea acevedoi, commonly known as the Acevedo's matelea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
